laboratory_examinations.findings: Showed a soft-tissue mass associated with the right carotid artery.
Showed a large, intensely enhancing mass measuring 2.6 × 2.6 × 4.6 cm at the right carotid bifurcation and a slightly smaller mass measuring 2.0 × 2.5 × 3.9 cm on the left side.
Revealed no signs of catecholamine or dopamine production.
Did not show any signs of cardiac ischemia or primary heart blockage.
Heart rate dropped from approximately 60 bpm to approximately 30 bpm; noted hypotension with systolic blood pressure in the 70s to 80s.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Episodes of bradycardia and hypotension noted during the night, but resolved spontaneously.
